09:37  Hi vmassol 09:37  yes please :) 09:38  there are 3 modules, right? 09:38  (that's not very nice btw, there could be only one, can be fixed later when we start using webjars) 09:38  yes 3 modules 09:39  ok for webjars 09:40  has joined #xwiki 09:42  sbaloul\_\_: done 09:42  thanks :) 09:43  has joined #xwiki 09:50  has joined #xwiki 09:50  has quit 09:58  hi, how can i filter hql query by Database List value? if i use DBStringListProperty, hibernate is complaining it doesn't know value param (in xwiki.hbm.xml there are only three params -> id, name and list) 10:05  is now known as 10:13  greetings :) 10:18  solved, DBListClass is actually StringProperty 10:24  I am struggling to get the maven packager plugin running to automatically load my xml files into the db :/ 10:25  spu7nic: you mean your xar files ? 10:26  The xar import via REST is working - but it takes some time :) 10:26  Therefore I stumbled upen the maven packager plugin 10:26  xwiki-packager-plugin 10:26  they use pretty much use the same code behind the scene I think 10:27  tmortagne: I got the maven tasks running, but it doesn't seem to do anything 10:27  which goal did you use ? 10:27  I tried export and import 10:27  export is not going to help here :) 10:28  I thought so … but after import did not work you always get creative ^^ 10:28  what do you get in the log with import ? 10:28  and what's your pom.xml 10:29  the log just says BUILD SUCCESS 10:29  also you should look at https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/tree/master/xwiki-enterprise-data which is using import goal 10:30  http://pastebin.com/3Vhx2FA1 10:31  I doubt it will work without the hibernate configuration (its commented in your pom.xml) 10:32  I tried it first without the commented - and he was looking for src/main/packager/hibernate.cfg.xml 10:32  so i just moved the file there 10:33  ha maybe indeed 10:33  you want to import XAR that you previously deployed in a maven repository ? 10:33  or is it just some XML you have in your project ? 10:33  Not really, I want to edit the xml files directly within IntelliJ and push them into the db of a running instance 10:34  by default what import goal does is to import all XAR you have as dependencies 10:35  to import XML you have in your sources you need to indicate here they are with sourceDirectory 10:35  since it is a little uncomfortable to change things in the browser and always do a xar export -> extract -> put into project -> commit ^^ 10:36  spu7nic: you could use http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/GitHubApp 10:36  (commit documents from the wiki) 10:37  there is also http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/SVN+Application 10:37  tmortagne: doesn't it take a lot of time for a commit to get pushed into the wiki? 10:38  tmortagne: atm I am running two open browser windows and just do a save + refresh 10:38  I think http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/GitHubApp handle git -> wiki, only wiki -> git 10:39  \*don't 10:39  or I did not understand your question 10:40  I was suggesting you to directly modify and commit from the wiki instead or going through the fs 10:40  I thought so :) 10:40  has joined #xwiki 10:40  but if you also need to update the wiki and things comming from git then indeed it's a different matter 10:41  in any case what you are missing from import goal is probably sourceDirectory property 10:42  tmortagne: I'll give it a try :) 10:42  but I doubt you will get something much quicker than REST 10:42  REST is that slow ? 10:43  building the xar takes a few seconds, importing at takes another few seconds. So one roundtrip is between 9 to 15 secs 10:43  instead of pressing save and refresh ^^ 10:44  few second to build the XAR sound a lot, is it a big XAR ? 10:44  or you mean you build it using mvm package ? 10:44  which indeed take the time maven take 10:45   i do :) 10:45  which is a lot more than just create a XAR file 10:45  did you tried 10:45  ? 10:46  might speed up the generation 10:46  since that's what actually do the generation 10:46  It is a little quicker - but still takes 4 secs 10:47  Maybe I ll just take a look at the packager sources and create a little IntelliJ extension, which pushes the files automatically into the database 10:49  if you do such extension it might be safer to do it using REST (and a lt easier since it mean you just have to zip files and send them through HTTP) 10:51  you mean -> zip xml to xar -> post to rest? 10:51  has joined #xwiki 10:55  spu7nic: if you already have the package.xml file yes, otherwise you also have to generate it 10:56  which is not very complex, you can get the code from XAR plugin or use https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/tree/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-xar library 10:58  has joined #xwiki 10:59  has joined #xwiki 11:04  Great :) - that will be my "little fun project" when I am done with our next sprint :) 11:05  would be a great tool :) 11:06  Full ACK :) 11:13  has quit 11:14  has joined #xwiki 11:50  gdelhumeau: there's a config option in the url module for path-based and wik-based 11:50  StandardURLConfiguration 11:50  isPathBasedMultiWiki() 11:51  vmassol: StandardURLConfiguration is internal it seems 11:51  yes 11:51  I didn't expose anything yet in the standard impl 11:51  but we can use them ourselves 11:52  because we release everything together so we can update our code if it changes 11:52  gdelhumeau needs to expose it for script 11:52  scripts 11:52  we need to decide who owns this config: url or wiki module 11:52  yes 11:53  when I wrote it there was no wiki module 11:53  we also need to add getAliasSuffix(), which would be a good setting 11:53  xwiki-platform-url-standard depends on xwiki-platform-wiki-api so we'd better say wiki module :) 11:53  right now hte config property is: url.standard.multiwiki.isPathBased 11:54  so changing this would mean deprecating this config property and providing a legacy of legacy 11:54  right now url module provides a legacy impl for "xwiki.virtual.usepath" 11:55  but there is still a lot of places where xwiki.virtual.usepath is used 11:55  yes and they need to be updated as well 11:55  at the very least we must not add more places 11:55  url module is still not used eveyrwhere guillaume 11:55  url parsing is implemented 11:55  but not url serialization 11:56  note that there are other properties that might be better in the iwki module such as: getWikiNotFoundBehavior 11:56  actually they are the only 2 properties that could go in the wiki module 11:57  (isPathBasedMultiWiki() and getWikiNotFoundBehavior()) 11:58  now 11:58  you should need to have this in a script I think 11:58  \*shjouldn'(t 11:58  \*shouldn't 11:58  the URL should be computed in the url module 11:58  it should be transparent for your script 11:58  AFAIK the knowledge of whether it's path-based or domain-based is only used for URL compuation ATM 11:58  well, I need to set what is the default alias of a new wiki 11:59  hmm 11:59  playground is not the same thing than playground.xwiki.org 11:59  indeed 12:03  and a script service to know the alias suffix would be nice to propose a good computed alias in the wizard that the user can change 12:04  yes 12:04  I think you should send a proposal to move the 2 properties from the standard url module to the wiki module and handle legacy 12:04  for 6.x 12:06  yes 12:07  now, what should I do for 5.4.4? 12:07  because of XWIKI-10181 12:07  would be nice to fix the issue I had for the upgrade + the broken link when clicking continue 12:07  but it doesn't need to be nice from an architecture POV 12:08  (architecture/design) 12:15  then I propose http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10185 12:19  Is there a preferred javascript library for client side validation? 12:20  Ignore the question :) 12:21  we used to have this: 12:21  http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Creating+a+form+with+validation+and+tooltips#HClientsidevalidationwithLiveValidation 12:21  but since we are moving out from prototypeJS... 12:22  toward jquery? 12:30  yes 12:41  has quit 13:04  so it's better to already use jquery with requirejs or jsx instead of prototype? 13:16  is there any example of using computedField? i need to use it in database list as value and i guess it doesn't work because of empty "custom display" (script is {{velocity}}${doc.fullName}{{/velocity}})... of course if there is a way how to use doc.fullname in Database List as field param, it would be even better 13:26  has joined #xwiki 13:27  DefaultStandardURLConfiguration#isPathBasedMultiWiki() does not fallback to xwiki.virtual.usepath 13:27  vmassol: so I should rely on xwiki.virtual.usepath actually 13:28  from what I see in xwiki.properties: The URL module is a feature still in development and as such should be considered experimental at the moment 13:31  gdelhumeau: this is deprecated and replaced by the url config 13:32  the url module is used 13:32  it does all url parsing 13:32  I'll update that comment 13:33  ah hmmm 13:33  I see what you mean 13:33  as I said we use a LegacyStandardURLConfiguration 13:33  so if you use StandardURLConfiguration you're fine 13:33  since it supports backward compat 13:33  you can check the code for LegacyStandardURLConfiguration 13:35  so to summarize: 13:35  - for java code you should use StandardURLConfiguration 13:35  - for end users, they should use xwiki.virtual.usepath 13:35  I'm leaving that comment since it's still true 13:53  spu7nic: yes use jquery with require.js 13:54  has quit 13:54  spu7nic: require(['jquery'], function ($) { $('body').append('

Have Fun!

'); }); 13:55  err $('#body').append('

you get the idea

'); 13:58  thx - already found that sample :) 14:11  has quit 14:20  has joined #xwiki 14:20  has joined #xwiki 14:22  looks like we have a weird issue with XWikiBannedDependencies 14:23  "Unsupported major.minor version 51.0" when loading the class it seems 14:23  ha I think I know... 14:23  should be ok now 14:25  has joined #xwiki 14:26  has quit 14:27  has joined #xwiki 14:29  has quit 14:30  has quit 14:33  has quit 14:34  vmassol: I don't understand 14:35  when I do @Inject private StandardURLConfiguration standardURLConfiguration; 14:35  I do not have the result expected 14:37  using the debugger, I see it goes to DefaultStandardURLConfiguration 14:37  and it's not expected ? 14:38  it does not provide fallback 14:38  fallback ? 14:38  to  xwiki.virtual.usepath 14:38  but if you get DefaultStandardURLConfiguration then you don't have injection issue, right ? 14:38  it does " this.configuration.getProperty(PREFIX + "multiwiki.isPathBased", defaultValue);" 14:39  right 14:39  maybe I should specify the hint to "legacy" I don't know 14:39  has quit 14:39  the one with the fallback is in xwiki-platform-legacy-url 14:40  nothing to do with the hint 14:40  has joined #xwiki 14:40  so what should I do to use it? 14:40  your "problem" is that you simply don't have the legacy one in your classpath 14:40  but it's not really your problem 14:40  don't worry about that 14:40  LegacyStandardURLConfiguration automatically ovewrite DefaultStandardURLConfiguration 14:41  hhhm I see 14:41  on your side all you need to know if that StandardURLConfiguration give your the right configuration 14:41  Ok I understand 14:41  on my snapshot version I do not have legacy indeed 14:41  so I have to modify the new property in xwiki.properties 14:41  not the other one 14:41  yep 14:42  now it's clear 14:42  thanks 14:42  ( gdelhumeau is using deprecated configuration, booo ) 14:42  :D 14:43  (ok I had forgotten this new configuration even existed 1h ago) 14:43  ^^ 14:43  there is a bit of a taking-out-the-trash problem when there is more deprecated code than non-deprecated code ;) 14:47  has joined #xwiki 14:53  gdelhumeau: you must inject the interface 14:53  wait that's correect 14:53  :) 14:53  it is the interface 14:53  :) 14:53  yes legacy is built with -Plegacy 14:53  ah it's clear now ok 14:54  sorry was reading from top to bottom :) 14:54  has joined #xwiki 14:54  has quit 14:56  has quit 14:57  Ha, our office has to evacuated :) - a bomb from 2nd world war will be disarmed ^\_^ 14:57  Have a nice day/evening/whater :D 14:57  ouch, good luck 14:58  It's a free afternoon - so I am quite happy ^\_° 14:59  Bye :) 14:59  has quit 15:12  is it BFD today? 15:12  ha right, totally forgot about that 15:14  do you like my commit? 15:14  " @since 5.4.4M1 " erf 15:15  since @since indeed :) 15:17  gdelhumeau: I don't think you need 
 when you use {@code

15:51  Hello, I don't fully understand XWiki Stream. What and how should I specify under "Input Configuration - Entities"? Can you please advise? Regards, helge  
15:54  helge: tmortagne might be able to help you. Just know that I know someone from the community working on a tutorial for importing from confluence and it should be ready in a few days. Is confluence importing your use case?  
15:55  vmassol: no, just export form one xwiki instance as xar and importing to another. Should not be too hard.  
15:56  helge: you could jsut use standard import and export then  
15:57  (they use wiki stream under the hood)  
15:57  see:  
15:57  http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/ImportExport  
15:57  helge: why don't you use standard export/import ?  
15:57  (they use wiki stream on latest versions only)  
15:58  because I want the exported xar to be stored on the server machine, not downloaded through the web. Is that possible with standard export?  
15:58  no it's not possible in standard export  
15:58  tmortagne: so that's why.  
15:59  that's possible with wiki stream?  
15:59  helge: if you want to export everything then let entities empty, this is the list of entities to export  
15:59  you should have "The entities to take into account or skip" description associated  
15:59  vmassol: everything is possible with wiki stream :)  
15:59  hehe :)

16:37  Oh, right

16:38  which specifies where the topFilters HTML fragment is inserted
